title: 'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
body:
Hi,

I am cross-compiling for `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` on a Kaby Lake host and ever since the upgrade to the `1.28` toolchain, despite the build going through just fine, I am overwhelmed by the following output that seems to be a recent regression:

```
$ cargo build --examples --release --target=armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf
warning: unused manifest key: build
warning: unused manifest key: package.is-it-maintained-issue-resolution
warning: unused manifest key: package.is-it-maintained-open-issues
warning: unused manifest key: package.maintenance
   Compiling PROJECT v0.1 (file:///home/main/Desktop/PROJECT)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
...
...
...
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
'skylake' is not a recognized processor for this target (ignoring processor)
    Finished release [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 5.91s
```

Here is my `~/.cargo/config`:
```
[target.armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf]
linker = "arm-linux-gnueabihf-gcc"
ar = "arm-linux-gnueabihf-ar"
rustflags = ["-C", "target-feature=+v7,+vfp3,+a9,+neon", "-C", "target-cpu=native"]
```

Is anyone else experiencing this? Any workarounds or fixes in the horizon?

Thanks.
